com.barryholroyd.prodlisthpdemo.product_info

Class ProductListRecyclerAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<ProductListRecyclerAdapter.ProductListViewHolder>
      • com.barryholroyd.prodlisthpdemo.product_info.ProductListRecyclerAdapter

  • public class ProductListRecyclerAdapter
extends android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<ProductListRecyclerAdapter.ProductListViewHolder>
    Recycler adapter to display the list of products.

    For demonstration purposes I've implemented both Threads-based and an AsyncTask-based approaches for loading images.

    Author:
    Barry Holroyd

    • Field Detail

      • a

        private final android.app.Activity a
        Standard Activity instance.

      • pial

        private final ProductInfoArrayList pial
        Array of products. Each cell contains information about the specific product. This is filled in, in batches, from JSON pulled from the cloud.

      • pihm

        private final java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,ProductInfo> pihm
        Mapping table of ProductId to ProductInfo, for quick lookup.

      • getProductInfoArrayList

        public ProductInfoArrayList getProductInfoArrayList()
        Getter for the backing array list. Needed for bundling/unbundling across device configuration changes.
        Returns:
        ArrayList backing storage for the adapter.

      • onCreateViewHolder

        public ProductListRecyclerAdapter.ProductListViewHolder onCreateViewHolder(android.view.ViewGroup vg,
                                                                           int viewType)
        Create a ViewHolder to contain a View for each row, inflated from an XML layout file.
        Specified by:
        onCreateViewHolder in class android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<ProductListRecyclerAdapter.ProductListViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        vg - the ViewGroup into which the new View will be added after it is bound to an adapter position
        viewType - the viewType of the new View. In this implementation, it is actually a value from the ProductListRecyclerAdapter.ViewType enum.
        Returns:
        a new ViewHolder that holds a View of the given view type new ViewHolder.

      • onBindViewHolder

        public void onBindViewHolder(ProductListRecyclerAdapter.ProductListViewHolder viewHolder,
                             int position)
        Fill in the ViewHolder passed in with the data at "position" in the array. This is done by calling a method on the ViewHolder itself, so that that data can remain private to the ViewHolder.
        Specified by:
        onBindViewHolder in class android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<ProductListRecyclerAdapter.ProductListViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        viewHolder - ViewHolder which should be updated to represent the contents of the item at the given position in the data set.
        position - the position of the item within the adapter's data set. Position 0 represents the header and so isn't actually in the data set; Position 1 represents the first item in the actual data set, so we subtract 1 from any position value greater than 0.

      • getItemViewType

        public int getItemViewType(int position)
        Overrides:
        getItemViewType in class android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<ProductListRecyclerAdapter.ProductListViewHolder>

      • getItemCount

        public int getItemCount()
        Return the number of items in the backing array.
        Specified by:
        getItemCount in class android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<ProductListRecyclerAdapter.ProductListViewHolder>
        Returns:
        the number of items in the backing array (plus 1 for the header).

      • updateData

        public void updateData(ProductInfoArrayList pialNew)
        Update the array of products and redisplay the product list.
        Parameters:
        pialNew - the array of new products to add to the data set.
